storyInfo: Kal'tsit and the Doctor run into Mephisto, now transformed into a monster, in the core of the sarcophagus.

attributes.content: This herd is incredibly tough.
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: Not only do these mutated Sarkaz Infected have much better healing capabilities than normal possessed Infected, they are much more intelligent, too.
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: But that still doesn't give us a way to actually talk to them. They all seem so... strange. Like they're all in some place else.
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: Not only that, this type of mutation is an accident waiting to happen. The crystals form way too fast.
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: The concentration of crystal dust in the air is the highest right here.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: That probably means that whoever is controlling the Herd here has most likely taken over the sarcophagus of the Chernobog core city already.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Things are always happening in places we don't have our eyes on.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: I really can't even begin to imagine what we'll be facing from here on out.
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: ...I don't mind getting an earful for this, Doctor, but I have to say this. This is way too difficult.
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: What we are doing might just be suicide. And, most importantly, I really don't think we have what it takes to save this city and Lungmen.
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.options: Let's not demoralize ourselves.;......;There are still things we need to do.

attributes.content: Chard, if memory serves, you have a family, don't you?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: I'm surprised you remember, Doctor. You got one detail wrong, though. My wife and my daughter don't care about me anymore, so I don't really have one.
attributes.name: Chard

attributes.content: Chard, have you ever thought about seeing them, and start living with them once again?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: I dreamed about it.
attributes.name: Chard

attributes.content: The first step to turning your dreams into reality is to give yourself the chance to dream.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Stopping Chernobog isn't going to make life any harder for the Infected.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Give your daughter a chance, Chard. Give her the chance to see her father again.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: I'll do as you say, Doctor.
attributes.name: Chard

attributes.options: You're just taking him for a ride.

attributes.content: What I said may have been a lie. I don't think the world is going to become a better place overnight, and there's basically no way the Infected will get to go back to their previous lives.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: But what I said could also be the truth.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Suppose we leave this place right now. He will never have the chance to see his daughter again, regardless of whether his family or he himself die of other causes in the events that will transpire.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: And suppose we aren't able to solve the problem we are facing right now. Most broader academic research will forever remain theories and nothing more.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: The successes of those who put in the work is what gives us the right to continue.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: There are countless people trying to revolutionize the system for the Infected, but all it takes is one failure, and not only will they forever lose the right to try that, we will never again have that opportunity again.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: If you need a more suitable metaphor, consider the concept, 'life'.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: ...Each time a major operation ends in success, we live to see another day. On the other hand, failure means death.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: There is no such thing as coming back from the dead in science.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: We only have one chance to save our lives. We will come to face many disasters, and it will be the end of us each time an accident happens. That's both ourselves individually or Rhodes Island as a whole.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Disasters like Chernobog are bound to happen again and again. If we fail to solve a problem like that even once, we will die.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: On one hand, we have to stop the disease before it catches up and overwhelms all of us. On the other hand, we need to save ourselves from within this storm.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: I'm not singing Rhodes Island's praises. Not too much, at least. It's just, right here, right now, this is a problem that only we can handle.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Most of us only get to live once. Once our lives are lost, it's gone forever.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.options: You mean there are people who gets to live several lives?

attributes.content: Uh, that's not really what I'm trying to say. What I mean is that there are people who haven't ever treasured their own lives.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: There are a lot of people who have never been around anything normal ever since they were born. Twisted places will only bear twisted fruits.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: The reason there is so much malice in Chernobog is precisely because there has always been malice not kept in check there.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Malice, or more precisely, all those chains of malice aren't going to disappear on their own.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Each destruction, each killing might only have been caused by a modicum of desire. In a lawless land, barbarism is simply left to breed rampantly on its own, and that is how it becomes the law of the land.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: And this kind of law is much stronger than the law you'd find in the cities. It's simply indestructible.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: That's violence. The violence that flows in our blood veins comes from the parts of us left untamed by civilization.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Listen.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Did you hear that...?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: ...Singing...?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: How peculiar. Originium Arts don't usually interfere with my senses at all.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: All operators, put on your protective equipment!
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Dr. {@nickname}, something terrible might be happening.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Based on the chaos we've seen along the way, we probably would've reached this conclusion all the same, but I'm afraid what we are about to face might be far worse than what we could ever have imagined.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.options: Has it ever gone any other way?

attributes.content: I wouldn't say it's always a foregone conclusion.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Perhaps someone has placed a curse on either us or this city. That being said, curses can be broken.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: If you plant the seeds of evil, the flowers of evil will blossom, bearing fruits of evil. If we water the earth with goodwill, then even if this parcel of land doesn't get any better... at least it wouldn't meet such a dreadful fate and be buried by a tragedy like this.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: It's a shame...
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: You look in the same direction as Kal'tsit.
It's a shame that, as far as I know, evil is a vicious cycle that will only breed even worse malice, and fate is rarely kind to those who are kind at heart.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: I can't allow you to bring about yet another nightmare, Infected.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit
